entry.title: December 30, 2025
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY CONTINUES UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
entry.summary: December 30, 2025 4:10 a.m. An Air Stagnation Advisory remains in effect until 4:00 p.m. on Wednesday afternoon for central Douglas County and its eastern foothills, along with much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said air quality is likely to worsen due to an inversion and stagnant air conditions...

entry.title: REFERENDUM SECURES A QUARTER MILLION SIGNATURES AS OF MONDAY
entry.summary: December 30, 2025 3:50 a.m. Monday afternoon, the chief petitioners to the gas tax referendum turned in additional signatures to State Elections officials, bringing their total count to 250,900 Oregon voters who have signed the petition. A release from the Right to Vote on the Gas Tax PAC campaign said this is triple the 78,116...

entry.title: WATERMAIN BREAK CLEANUP CONTINUES ALONG WEST HARVARD AVENUE
entry.summary: December 30, 2025 3:40 a.m. The City of Roseburg is continuing to clean up and make repairs following a watermain break at the intersection of West Harvard Avenue and West Umpqua Street on Saturday night, December 20th. Public Works Director Ryan Herinckx told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the water line was...

entry.title: ENROLLED WOMEN VETERANS: GYNECOLOGY APPOINTMENTS WITHOUT REFERRAL
entry.summary: December 30, 2025 3:30 a.m. Information from the Roseburg VA Medical Center said enrolled women veterans can now schedule gynecology appointments without needing a referral from their primary care physician. Patients can still choose to continue receiving routine women’s health care, screening and services from their regular women’s health and primary care teams. Patients may...

entry.title: UMPQUA FISHERY ENHANCEMENT DERBY WITH 34TH ANNUAL EVENT
entry.summary: December 30, 2025 3:05 a.m. The Umpqua Fishery Enhancement Derby has its 34th annual event in late January. Drew Winkelmaier has more: “Drew2” News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN It is held to support restoration, enhancement, and education projects in the Umpqua Basin and will take place January 28th through the 31st. entry.title: ROSEBURG ELKS LODGE WITH 129TH BIRTHDAY BASH
entry.summary: December 30, 2025 3:05 a.m. Roseburg Elks Lodge #326 will have its 129th birthday bash next month. The event will be on Saturday, January 10th at the Elks on Southeast Jackson Street in downtown Roseburg. The evening includes no host cocktails in the lounge starting at 5:00 p.m. Dinner will begin at 6:00 p.m. Dancing...

entry.title: DRIVER TAKEN TO HOSPITAL FOLLOWING SEMI-TRUCK CRASH ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: December 30, 2025 2:50 a.m. The driver was taken to the hospital following a semi-truck crash on Saturday. An Oregon State Police report said just before 3:00 p.m. troopers were dispatched to the wreck on Interstate 5 southbound near the Riddle/Tri City Exit 103. Medical personnel on scene advised that the driver and sole occupant...

entry.title: City of Roseburg Issues Nuisance Notice to 79-Year-Old Homeowner Over Alleged Camping She Did Not Create
entry.summary: A 79-year-old Roseburg homeowner faces possible prosecution after the city issued a nuisance notice for camping and debris she says she did not create. The notice gives her 10 days to comply or pay a $306 appeal fee.

entry.title: New Year, New Laws: What’s Changing in Oregon on Jan. 1
entry.summary: Oregon rings in the new year with major law changes, including new rules on civil commitment, unemployment for striking workers, ticket sales, telemarketing, and marriage age. Several new consumer and public safety protections also take effect Jan. 1.

entry.title: Arrest Made in Connection With Fatal Shooting in Coos Bay
entry.summary: One person is dead following a shooting in Coos Bay Sunday afternoon. Police say a suspect is in custody, and the Coos County Major Crime Team is leading the investigation. The victim has been identified as 39-year-old David Orr.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 12.29.25
entry.summary: State Senator and Republican candidate for Governor, Christine Drazan has a update on her campaign, talks about the gas tax repeal effort, the upcoming short session and other topics.

entry.title: WINTER WHALE WATCH WEEK ON OREGON COAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: December 29, 2025 10:20 a.m. Oregon State Parks is hosting Winter Whale Watch Week along the Oregon Coast through Wednesday. An OPRD release said trained volunteers are stationed at 14 sites daily from 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 pm. to help visitors spot gray whales on their southward migration to the calving lagoons in Mexico. entry.title: COOS BAY POLICE INVESTIGATING SUNDAY HOMICIDE

The Coos County Major Crime Team was activated. Chief of Police Chris Chapanar said there were not any current public safety concerns...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 12.29.25
entry.summary: Amy Taylor from the Festival of Lights talks about the annual event, which wraps up Thursday night at River Forks Park.

entry.title: NMFS denies Oregon, California coastal Chinook salmon status under Endangered Species Act
entry.summary: The National Marine Fisheries Service and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration has determined that two coastal Chinook salmon groups, the Oregon Coast and the Southern Oregon and Northern California Coastal populations, do not warrant protection under the Endangered Species Act.

Crews follow a cyclical, systematic route to help residents with leaf disposal and to ensure that leaf collection is provided in an...

entry.title: CHRISTMAS TREE RECYCLING UNDERWAY THROUGH JANUARY 12TH
entry.summary: December 29, 2025 3:30 a.m. Roseburg Disposal’s annual Christmas tree recycling program is underway through January 12th. The Douglas County Landfill is partnering with the company to provide free disposal of collected trees. entry.title: WARMING CENTER TO ACTIVATE FOR SUNDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 27, 2025 10:30 a.m . The United Community Action Network will open the Roseburg Warming Center on Sunday night in response to temperatures dropping within activation thresholds. Check-in and a meal will be offered from 5:30 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. in the St. Joseph’s Catholic Church gymnasium at 630 West Stanton Street. Monday morning...
